result.execSummary:
The defendant William P Edwards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 12/01/2015 and each month thereafter or penalty of 11 days jail, consecutive for non-payment. 
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody, otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 109 days were granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant William P Edwards in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court peforms plea colloquy and finds Defendant guity of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

30 DAYS JAIL  (CREDIT - 109 days)   **CONCURRENT**


**Defendant to provide DNA sample, immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department. 

COSTS:  $343.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 12/1/15, alternate 11 days jail)

ADDRESS INFO for William P Edwards
Current: C/O Waukesha County Jail,   (Effective: 09-10-2015)
Prior: 102 N Racine Ave #1, Waukesha, WI 53186
Dated 08/28/15, from Atty Bricco to Judge Carter, requesting a plea and sentencing date on 15CM1088 after the revocation hearing on 14CF47 & 13CM2058.
Jury trial - 12 person on October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant William P Edwards in court with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco requests a jury status and jury trial and speedy trial demand. Court grants request.    Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
WC inmate communication received today from the Defendant, requesting a speedy trial and "to waive preliminary hearing".

Defendant William P Edwards in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie B. Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Bricco requests an adjournment after 8/5/15.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or her residence or children listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant William P Edwards in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
